newsitem.title: FRANCE: Third of EU maize award to benefit Argentina.
newsitem.headline: Third of EU maize award to benefit Argentina.

text.p: Over a third of a preferential maize import award for Spain granted by the European Union on Thursday will cover maize from Argentina rather than the more usual U.S. origin, French cereals office ONIC said.
It said that of the 328,703 tonnes of imported maize awarded tariff cuts up to 59.77 Ecus per tonne on Thursday, 127,000 tonnes would be supplied from Argentina.
The preferential maize import regime, dating from a 1987 trade accord compensating Washington for Spain's accession to the EU, usually applies to imports from the United States.
Although Argentine maize has benefitted from tariff cuts in the past, Thursday's share is an unusually high volume, officials said.
The EU awarded the cuts at a tender in which 800,000 tonnes of maize had been available for tariff reductions.
The tender continues each Thursday until June 26 or until all the maize has been awarded, barring an increase in the volume allocated by the European Commission.
